intro: Psychotria pubescens, commonly known as the hairy psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are covered in fine, pubescent hairs. It produces small, white or pale green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. The plant is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forest understories.
